reviewText:
Hordelicious(Made by Marko Silvasvuori) is an fantastic wave based arena shooter where you fight against enemies with lots of randomly looted weapons and some buyable upgrades/items.

I have played a lot Hordelicious non-steam version and it was really fantastic! Game is really fast and hard, maps are beatiful and small, from all sides we are attacked by lots of enemies from small ones to really big ones. What we need do? Survive! To Wave 11 and then kill boss! So we unlock new maps!

The good
+ Cheap price!
+ First game made by Marko (Woah! is really good)
+ 5 maps! (Will be more, maybe)
+ Over 50 weapons (Even Toaster)
+ About 7 types of enemies
+ Boss arena (After beating game)
+ 5 bosses
+ Shop (Where you can buy items/upgrades)
+ Upgrades
+ Is not boring! (All time you want back to Hordelicious)
+ Achievements!

The bad
NONE


Hordelicious is just delicious i recommend it to all people who is bored and want good cheap game!

reviewText: This is like if you'd take Crimsonland, cut out about 70% of its content and stick whatever remained in a hip and modern, blocky" graphical style. It's really fun once it's fresh and new to you
date: but this fun curve dips down shortly afterwards and doesn't recover. The game suffers massively from repetition and tedium
recommended: there's nothing hardcore or "semi-hardcore" about this. Where other twin-stick shooters are able to keep things interesting with more perks
hoursPlayed: enemies and level ideas (ie. Crimsonland) or graphics
voteText: or story (ex. Alien Breed

reviewText:
This is a fun game...intense and gripping...I thank any listening Gods for the upgrade break in between  the waves.It gives me a chance to regulate my heart beat and breathing before the next blitzkrieg ensues....I'm honestly just bracing myself for what,thus far, I can only equate to those wolves on don't starve coming for me as my torch is fading...Yes...those red cinnamon tic tacs of doom.

An online co-op would be great...

but... before that...I would love for there to be some type of statistical online leader boards...

as,this is a bragging rights kind of game.

C'mon,pick it up.

You won't be sorry.

Promise. :)

reviewText:
For $4... no.

For $1... maybe...

No fun upgrade, no level system, no save or check points, no combos...

A really plain and straight forward hord game. A billion clones, many better, available free in your browser. I mean... it's okay, but really not bringing anything new to the table or anything worth paying for at this point.

reviewText:
The game is ideal for short sessions. It has a nice looking graphics.
Music and sound weapons, monsters, etc. are good (but could be more music tracks).
There are five levels and each one occurs in several variants.
You can buy upgrades and various useful things (candy and more blood do not make sense ... they do not provide anything ... the sweets could to restore some health;) ).

The game seems to be really enjoyable but ...

is Very difficult ...

Of course, I do not consider this a disadvantage.
But after updating, the game had become too difficult.
On the map appears more creatures and after a while there are too many (and I mean these waves in which there are large, green, fast creatures).
Almost two hours I try to go eighth wave in the fifth level (once I did, but that was before the upgrade).
SteamSpy shows that almost a thousand people have this game and only 2.9% of players completed the game. (It shows that the game is really difficult.)
Of course I will continue to try to move this game.

In the game should be a change weapons
(to better weapons leave for later;) ).
The game could have co-op mode.
Should also be difficulty levels. (level easy - no traps ;) ).



Sorry for my bad english-I'm still learning.



[Update]

Finally I managed to go through the game.
This game is as difficult as Dark Souls.

reviewText:
What I didn't expect in this game is toasters

It's a good time-killing game, with a variety of weapons such as toasters, swords, and 4-barrel miniguns and a challenging difficulty, you'll pass time with this somewhat addictive game. On the other side it's graphics is friendly even to a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ laptop, and it's offline so it's available for you to play without internet. On the negative side I found the soundtrack to be not adrenaline-pumping, even though this is probably a stress-taking game

Worth a shot

reviewText:
Usually all the free games I get from Steam keys aren't the best type of games. I won a giveaway and received this. This game is absolutely amazing if you're into short indie zombie action. I guess you can say it's in the rogue-like section considering you start over when you die, but here are the ups and downs of this game.
------------------
UpsFree Steam key given to me
Fun to play for a little while
A cheep, cool game to recommend to friends
In-game upgrades to enhance your gameplay
Cool levels
Several weapons
Etc.
------------------
DownsNot-so-great replay value
Game hasn't gotten a lot of attention (at least review-wise)
Etc.
------------------
I hope my review has assisted you to make your decision on this fine product! Best of luck to you who buy it, and/or I hope you can find another great game that can satisfy you! :)

reviewText:
How to fix the game !
Go to:
C: > Program Files (x86) > Steam > steamapps > common > Hordelicious
Delete the file steam_api.dll and enjoy the game.

Nice game, but the achievements aren't working =(

reviewText: Looks are definately decieving with this game.  Don't let the apparent blandness fool you--the gameplay and controls are excellent.  I would REALLY like to see gamepad support implemented since this is the type of game that excels with a twin-stick controller.  Still highly entertaining despite that!  Also, there are some very interesting and unexpected weapon pickups (battleaxe, guitar, etc).

I find that this game is abit addicting when you first started it.
The amount of weapons there is in the game is decent, which is good. I love the part where you're able to get melee weapons from weapon crates.
I find that monster spawning is slow on the first run, which dulls the experience for me, because i can't beat the first boss yet and i'm tired of waiting to get through the waves.
The graphics are pretty good, i got nothing esle to comment for that point.
So in my overall experience, i recommand buying this game if you're bored and wish to play something simple.

reviewText:
The game is worth its price, but it also has its flaws. I won't talk about the gameplay, others have described it well enough. However, I have 2 gripes with this game:

- You can't change the controls and are bound to WASD. Which isn't practical at all when you don't have a QWERTY keyboard. Also, I'm too lazy to change that manually in the .ini that must be somewhere on my computer. So I have to activate the English keyboard layout. Shift+Alt isn't hard to do, but it's still annoying.

- The fullscreen mode isn't true fullscreen, as it doesn't retain the cursor on the used screen. Which means that when you have 2 or more screens, you might end up clicking on the edge of a secondary screen and end up seeing the game get minimized. Of course, it wouldn't be a major issue if the game paused itself when it lost the pointer's focus, but it doesn't. Which means that you will eventually die because of this. And it's very frustrating.  Also, there is no windowed mode as far as I know.

reviewText:
The game is worth its price, but it also has its flaws. I won't talk about the gameplay, others have described it well enough. However, I have 2 gripes with this game:

- You can't change the controls and are bound to WASD. Which isn't practical at all when you don't have a QWERTY keyboard. Also, I'm too lazy to change that manually in the .ini that must be somewhere on my computer. So I have to activate the English keyboard layout. Shift+Alt isn't hard to do, but it's still annoying.

- The fullscreen mode isn't true fullscreen, as it doesn't retain the cursor on the used screen. Which means that when you have 2 or more screens, you might end up clicking on the edge of a secondary screen and end up seeing the game get minimized. Of course, it wouldn't be a major issue if the game paused itself when it lost the pointer's focus, but it doesn't. Which means that you will eventually die because of this. And it's very frustrating.  Also, there is no windowed mode as far as I know.
